thread.title: See who's on the general election ballot in Cayuga County
thread.title_full: See who's on the general election ballot in Cayuga County

author: Michelle Breidenbach | mbreidenbach@syracuse.com
title: See who's on the general election ballot in Cayuga County
text:
See who's on the general election ballot in Cayuga County 2014-11-04-dl-vote1.JPG Cayuga County voters will go to the polls Nov. 3, 2015 to elect a mayor of Auburn, county legislators and town officials. (David Lassman | dlassman@syracuse.com) Comments 
AUBURN, N.Y. -- Cayuga County voters will elect a mayor of Auburn, county legislators and town officials in the general election on Nov. 3. 
It will be Round 3 in Auburn as Mayor Michael Quill and county Legislator Timothy Lattimore go head-to-head for the third consecutive time in the mayor's race. Lattimore was elected mayor in 2003, got beat by Quill by 92 votes in 2007, and then lost in a rematch by about 500 votes in 2011. 
In the only county-wide races, District Attorney Jon Budelmann and county Clerk Susan Dwyer have no opponents as they seek re-election. 
Polls will open at 6 a.m. and close at 9 p.m. To be eligible to vote, you have to register by Oct. 9. People who became honorably discharged veterans or naturalized citizens after Oct. 9 have until Oct. 24 to register. 
Here's who's on the ballot in all the races, with party designations. 
(Abbreviations for political parties: D = Democratic, R = Republican, C = Conservative, I = Independence, Ref. = Reform, A= Accountability, WF = Working Families, ST = Southern Team, Aub. = Auburn, FJ = Fair and Just, FE = Fair and Equal, P = Pride, M = Millstone, OCC = Owasco Concerned Citizens, LC = Lloyd Cornell, Rose = Rose) 
Vote for one unless otherwise noted. 
District Attorney
